org.opendaylight.controller.switchmanager.northbound

Class SwitchNorthbound

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opendaylight.controller.switchmanager.northbound.SwitchNorthbound

  • public class SwitchNorthbound
extends java.lang.Object
    The class provides Northbound REST APIs to access the nodes, node connectors and their properties.

      • getNodes

        public Nodes getNodes(java.lang.String containerName,
             java.lang.String queryString)
        Retrieve a list of all the nodes and their properties in the network
        Parameters:
        containerName - Name of the Container (Eg. 'default')
        Returns:
        A list of Pair each pair represents a Node and Set of Property attached to it. 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/switchmanager/default/nodes

 Response body in XML:
 <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
 <list>
        <nodeProperties>
               <node>
                      <id>00:00:00:00:00:00:00:02</id>
                      <type>OF</type>
               </node>
               <properties>
                      <tables>
                             <value>-1</value>
                      </tables>
                      <description>
                             <value>Switch2</value>
                      </description>
                      <actions>
                             <value>4095</value>
                      </actions>
                      <macAddress>
                             <value>00:00:00:00:00:02</value>
                      </macAddress>
                      <capabilities>
                             <value>199</value>
                      </capabilities>
                      <timeStamp>
                             <value>1377291227877</value>
                             <name>connectedSince</name>
                      </timeStamp>
                      <buffers>
                             <value>256</value>
                      </buffers>
               </properties>
        </nodeProperties>
 </list>

 Response body in JSON:
 {
    "nodeProperties":[
       {
          "node":{
             "id":"00:00:00:00:00:00:00:02",
             "type":"OF"
          },
          "properties":{
             "tables":{
                "value":"-1"
             },
             "description":{
                "value":"None"
             },
             "actions":{
                "value":"4095"
             },
             "macAddress":{
                "value":"00:00:00:00:00:02"
             },
             "capabilities":{
                "value":"199"
             },
             "timeStamp":{
                "value":"1377291227877",
                "name":"connectedSince"
             },
             "buffers":{
                "value":"256"
             }
          }
       }
    ]
 }

      • addNodeProperty

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response addNodeProperty(@Context
                                        javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                                        java.lang.String containerName,
                                        java.lang.String nodeType,
                                        java.lang.String nodeId,
                                        java.lang.String propertyName,
                                        java.lang.String propertyValue)
        Add a Description, Tier and Forwarding mode property to a node. This method returns a non-successful response if a node by that name already exists.
        Parameters:
        containerName - Name of the Container (Eg. 'default')
        nodeType - Type of the node being programmed (Eg. 'OF')
        nodeId - Node Identifier as specified by Node (Eg. '00:00:00:00:00:00:00:03')
        propertyName - Name of the Property. Properties that can be configured are: description, forwarding(only for default container) and tier
        propertyValue - Value of the Property. Description can be any string (Eg. 'Node1'), valid values for tier are non negative numbers, and valid values for forwarding are 0 for reactive and 1 for proactive forwarding.
        Returns:
        Response as dictated by the HTTP Response Status code 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/switchmanager/default/node/OF/00:00:00:00:00:00:00:03/property/description/Switch3

      • deleteNodeProperty

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response deleteNodeProperty(java.lang.String containerName,
                                           java.lang.String nodeType,
                                           java.lang.String nodeId,
                                           java.lang.String propertyName)
        Delete a property of a node
        Parameters:
        containerName - Name of the Container (Eg. 'SliceRed')
        nodeType - Type of the node being programmed (Eg. 'OF')
        nodeId - Node Identifier as specified by Node (Eg. '00:00:00:00:00:03:01:02')
        propertyName - Name of the Property. Properties that can be deleted are description, forwarding(only in default container) and tier.
        Returns:
        Response as dictated by the HTTP Response Status code 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/switchmanager/default/node/OF/00:00:00:00:00:00:00:03/property/forwarding

      • getNodeProperty

        public Property getNodeProperty(java.lang.String containerName,
                       java.lang.String nodeType,
                       java.lang.String nodeId,
                       java.lang.String propertyName)
        Get a property of a node
        Parameters:
        containerName - Name of the Container (Eg. 'SliceRed')
        nodeType - Type of the node being programmed (Eg. 'OF')
        nodeId - Node Identifier as specified by Node (Eg. '00:00:00:00:00:03:01:02')
        propertyName - Name of the Property. Properties that can be deleted are description, forwarding(only in default container) and tier.
        Returns:
        Property value of the property 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/switchmanager/default/node/OF/00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01/property/description

 Response body in XML
 <description>
       <value>switch1</value>
 </description>

 Response body in JSON
 {
       "value": "switch1"
 }

      • getNodeConnectors

        public NodeConnectors getNodeConnectors(java.lang.String containerName,
                               java.lang.String nodeType,
                               java.lang.String nodeId,
                               java.lang.String queryString)
        Retrieve a list of all the nodeconnectors and their properties in a given node
        Parameters:
        containerName - The container for which we want to retrieve the list (Eg. 'default')
        nodeType - Type of the node being programmed (Eg. 'OF')
        nodeId - Node Identifier as specified by Node (Eg. '00:00:00:00:00:00:00:03')
        Returns:
        A List of Pair each pair represents a NodeConnector and its corresponding Property attached to it. 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/switchmanager/default/node/OF/00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01

 Response body in XML:
 <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
 <list>
        <nodeConnectorProperties>
               <nodeconnector>
                      <node>
                             <id>00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01</id>
                             <type>OF</type>
                      </node>
                      <id>2</id>
                      <type>OF</type>
               </nodeconnector>
               <properties>
                      <state>
                             <value>1</value>
                      </state>
                      <config>
                             <value>1</value>
                      </config>
                      <name>
                             <value>L1_2-C2_1</value>
                      </name>
               </properties>
        </nodeConnectorProperties>
 </list>

 Response body in JSON:
 {
    "nodeConnectorProperties":[
       {
          "nodeconnector":{
             "node":{
                "id":"00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01",
                "type":"OF"
             },
             "id":"2",
             "type":"OF"
          },
          "properties":{
             "state":{
                "value":"1"
             },
             "config":{
                "value":"1"
             },
             "name":{
                "value":"L1_2-C2_1"
             }
          }
       }
    ]
 }

      • addNodeConnectorProperty

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response addNodeConnectorProperty(@Context
                                                 javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                                                 java.lang.String containerName,
                                                 java.lang.String nodeType,
                                                 java.lang.String nodeId,
                                                 java.lang.String nodeConnectorType,
                                                 java.lang.String nodeConnectorId,
                                                 java.lang.String propertyName,
                                                 java.lang.String propertyValue)
        Add node-connector property to a node connector. This method returns a non-successful response if a node connector by the given name already exists.
        Parameters:
        containerName - Name of the Container (Eg. 'default')
        nodeType - Type of the node being programmed (Eg. 'OF')
        nodeId - Node Identifier as specified by Node (Eg. '00:00:00:00:00:00:00:03')
        nodeConnectorType - Type of the node connector being programmed (Eg. 'OF')
        nodeConnectorId - NodeConnector Identifier as specified by NodeConnector. (Eg. '2'). If nodeConnecterId contains forward slash(/), replace forward slash with underscore(_) in the URL. (Eg. for Ethernet1/2, use Ethernet1_2)
        propertyName - Name of the Property specified by Property and its extended classes Property that can be configured is bandwidth
        propertyValue - Value of the Property specified by Property and its extended classes
        Returns:
        Response as dictated by the HTTP Response Status code 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/switchmanager/default/nodeconnector/OF/00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01/OF/2/property/bandwidth/1

      • deleteNodeConnectorProperty

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response deleteNodeConnectorProperty(java.lang.String containerName,
                                                    java.lang.String nodeType,
                                                    java.lang.String nodeId,
                                                    java.lang.String nodeConnectorType,
                                                    java.lang.String nodeConnectorId,
                                                    java.lang.String propertyName)
        Delete a property of a node connector
        Parameters:
        containerName - Name of the Container (Eg. 'default')
        nodeType - Type of the node being programmed (Eg. 'OF')
        nodeId - Node Identifier as specified by Node (Eg. '00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01')
        nodeConnectorType - Type of the node connector being programmed (Eg. 'OF')
        nodeConnectorId - NodeConnector Identifier as specified by NodeConnector (Eg. '1'). If nodeConnecterId contains forward slash(/), replace forward slash with underscore(_) in the URL. (Eg. for Ethernet1/2, use Ethernet1_2)
        propertyName - Name of the Property specified by Property and its extended classes. Property that can be deleted is bandwidth
        Returns:
        Response as dictated by the HTTP Response Status code 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/switchmanager/default/nodeconnector/OF/00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01/OF/2/property/bandwidth

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response saveSwitchConfig(java.lang.String containerName)
        Save the current switch configurations
        Parameters:
        containerName - Name of the Container (Eg. 'default')
        Returns:
        Response as dictated by the HTTP Response Status code 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/switchmanager/default/save
